creator: wickramasinghe.mohan@gmail.com
text:
A way to disable/activate nodes passing URL parameters to jkmanager.

Or use wildchar processing for worker names, to disable/activate them.

This would result in it being possible to automate the jkmanager disable/activate prcess.

You can disable/activate nodes via URL parameters for jk status worker. Simply use the GUI, do the action you want to do, and copy the URL shown in the browser before you get redirected after the successful operation. All request produced by the status worker GUI are GET requests, so you can see all parameters in the browser URL display.

If you are interested in how the parameters are constructed, get one example from your status worker and then look up the meaning of the parameters on

http://tomcat.apache.org/connectors-doc/reference/status.html

In version 1.2.28 you can also use wildcards in the URL parameters for load balancer member names, but only for update actions. Wildcard characters are '?' matching a single character and '*' matching any sequence of characters.
